column4: evenin' - gparted question. booted off cd. made a bunch of (significant) changes, hit "apply" and the gparted window disappeared -- and the cd-rom drive is making repetitive thrashy sounds (as in, it sounds like it's having trouble reading)
think it b0rked my drive already?
i can't imagine why it would need to read from the CD-ROM once it's doing its thing...?
see if it's still running with system monitor?
i'm running the gparted live cd
there are icons for terminal, info, and some other junk, but nothing seems to work.
i know this is a tough question.... aaaany advice is appreciated
it's a bit outside my comfort zone too - any way to get into some sort of shell?
You could check the hard disk activity light as well - silly suggestion but worth looking
good suggestion. been looking at it
i guess probably not doing anything - if it's moving data (resizing partitions, etc) it would probably be lit up quite a lot
if theres any way to get to a shell you should be able to see if it's still running
does it have ctrl+alt+f_something?
YES thank you
ps -ef | less  will list processes
cool
gparted starts up subprocesses with the command line resizing tools, etc. so don't just look for gparted :)
fyi, i asked somebody to flip a coin, and it came up with "REBOOT" and grub loaded and booted normally. then i came. now i'm going to run away from this dell as fast as i can.
phew!
it was either spend an evening trying to restore that machine *somehow* or not cancel a date. now i get to go get my flirt on. gotta remember not to mention linux, at all, ever, ever. ;)
good luck :) much more fun i hope
